isis.stitle: FULL POWER HYDRAULIC ABS BRAKE SYSTEM - GENERAL DESCRIPTION - SYSTEM LAYOUT

svcproc.title: SYSTEM LAYOUT
svcproc.para: A component location diagram of a typical Full Power Brakes system is illustrated in FIGURE 2. A schematic diagram of the system is provided in FIGURE 3. The Master Cylinder is mounted to the engine side of the cowl, in front of the driver. The wheel speed sensors are located at the wheel ends with the calipers and rotors. The Body Controller (ESC/BC) is mounted to the inside of the cowl, behind the instrument panel. The PARK BRAKE switch for the powered parking brake is located near the center of the dash. The Hydraulic Compact Unit is mounted on the inside of the left frame rail, behind the driver's position. The Spring Apply Hydraulic Release (SAHR) parking brake canister is mounted on the inside of the left frame rail, just ahead of the rear axle. The parking brake drum is located where the driveshaft connects to the rear axle.
A low pressure hose connects the reservoir on the HCU to the reservoir on the master cylinder. This allows both reservoirs to be filled from the master cylinder location. Refer to FIGURE 4.
